Hey guys, thanks for reporting this. We're looking into it, but we've been able to find a workaround for this issue in the [Help & Support Board](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/LpIqNmo4-after-downtime-and-patch-patcher-window-is-wrong-size?comment=0002).

It seems this is affecting players with non-default DPI settings. So if you're using anything above 100%, try resetting it back.

First, open your Control Panel. You can do this from the Start menu. When the panel opens, click on Appearance and Personalization:
http://i.imgur.com/yiH8MNF.png


Second, click on Display:
http://i.imgur.com/HYwsJCF.png


And finally, select the "Smaller - 100% (default)" option, then click Apply:
http://i.imgur.com/ewCCHkf.png


Re-launch your patcher afterwards.

Alternatively, you can use the Windows Key and search "Personalization" (without the quotes) and continue from the the second step onward.

I was unable to locate "Appearance and Personalization".  On my Windows 7 system, this setting appears under
Control Panel --> Display.  Hope this helps someone.

> I was unable to locate "Appearance and Personalization".  On my Windows 7 system, this setting appears under
> Control Panel --> Display.  Hope this helps someone.

This happens because the Control Panel has multiple views.

In Windows 7 the solution options are:

1. Start > Control Panel (View By: Categories) > Appearance and Personalization > Display > Set to 100%.

2. Start > Control Panel (View By: Large/Small Icons) > Display > Set to 100%.

3. Right-click Desktop > Screen Resolution > Make text and other items larger or smaller > Set to 100%.


The difference in Control Panel options is your "View by" setting, which is set by a drop down menu in the top right corner of the Control Panel window.

Personally, I use the Screen Resolution option on the desktop and use the "Make text and other items larger or smaller" hyperlink. It requires less clicks.
